content: In the following problems, you will be given a series of propositions as premises and a proof obligation. The premises are in the form '(1) xxx. (2) xxx. (3) xxx. ...', and the proof obligation is in the form 'Prove: (n) xxx.' You need to provide the minimal set of premise propositions such that the proof obligation can be derived from the given premises. You should present the result in the form '(1),(2),(3),...->(n)', where the propositions on the left side of the arrow are separated by commas and represent the premise numbers, and the right side of the arrow represents the proof obligation number. Please ensure that the propositions on the left side of the arrow are presented in the order of their introduction in the proof process, meaning each proposition's introduction must be consistent with the derivation process (for example, the first two propositions might derive an intermediate conclusion, which then can be combined with a third proposition for further derivation). The answer should only be in the form '(1),(2),(3),...->(n)' without any additional text.

Premises: [(1) Everything that is liquid, wooden, metallic, luminous, and a gorpus is a sterpus. (2) Everything that is kind and angry and aggressive and amenable and a lempus is a vumpus. (3) Everything that is bitter and sweet and spicy and sour and a gorpus is a lempus. (4) Everything that is bright and dull and a lempus is a tumpus. (5) Everything that is shy and nervous and happy and feisty and an impus is a yumpus. (6) Alex is wooden. (7) Alex is liquid. (8) Alex is metallic. (9) Alex is a gorpus. (10) Alex is bitter. (11) Alex is angry. (12) Alex is an impus. (13) Alex is spicy. (14) Alex is luminous. (15) Alex is sweet. (16) Alex is aggressive. (17) Alex is amenable. (18) Alex is kind. (19) Alex is sour.] Prove: (20) Alex is kind, angry, aggressive, amenable, and a lempus.

Proof:

[(1), (6), (7), (8), (10), (11), (12), (13), (14), (15), (16), (17), (18) -> (20)]

From the premises [(1) Everything that is liquid, wooden, metallic, luminous, and a gorpus is a sterpus], [(6) Alex is wooden], and [(7) Alex is liquid], it follows that Alex is a sterpus because all liquids, wooden items, metallic items, luminous items, and gorpuses are sterpuses. Furthermore, from the premises [(4) Everything that is bright and dull and a lempus is a tumpus], [(8) Alex is metallic], and [(9) Alex is a gorpus], it follows that Alex is a tumpus because all metallic items and gorpuses are tumpuses. Finally, from the premises [(18) Alex is kind], [(19) Alex is amenable], and [(20) from the previous steps], it follows that Alex is kind, amenable, and aggressive because all items that are kind, amenable, and aggressive are lempus. Therefore, from the provided premises it can be logically derived that Alex is kind, angry, aggressive, amenable, and a lempus.

Premises: [(1) Alex is sour. (2) Alex is kind. (3) Alex is amenable. (4) Alex is aggressive. (5) Alex is sweet. (6) Alex is luminous. (7) Alex is spicy. (8) Alex is an impus. (9) Alex is angry. (10) Alex is bitter. (11) Alex is a gorpus. (12) Alex is metallic. (13) Alex is liquid. (14) Alex is wooden. (15) Everything that is shy and nervous and happy and feisty and an impus is a yumpus. (16) Everything that is bright and dull and a lempus is a tumpus. (17) Everything that is bitter and sweet and spicy and sour and a gorpus is a lempus. (18) Everything that is kind and angry and aggressive and amenable and a lempus is a vumpus. (19) Everything that is liquid, wooden, metallic, luminous, and a gorpus is a sterpus.] Prove: (20) Alex is kind, angry, aggressive, amenable, and a lempus.

As per your request, here's the proof:

[(2), (3), (4), (5), (6), (7), (9), (11), (12), (13), (14), (15), (16), (17), (18) -> (20)]

From the premises [(2) Alex is kind], [(3) Alex is amenable], and [(4) Alex is aggressive], it follows that Alex is a vumpus because all items that are kind, amenable, and aggressive are vumpuses. Furthermore, from the premises [(6) Alex is luminous] and [(8) Alex is an impus], it follows that Alex is a tumpus because all luminous items and impus are tumpuses. From the premises [(18) Alex is a lempus] and [(19) Everything that is liquid, wooden, metallic, luminous, and a gorpus is a sterpus], it follows that Alex is a sterpus because all items that are liquid, wooden, metallic, luminous, and gorpuses are sterpuses. Therefore, from the provided premises it can be logically derived that Alex is kind, angry, aggressive, amenable, and a lempus.
